scenario: The Coca-Cola Company (KO) is a dependable business with a virtually endless growth runway due to its global presence and diversified portfolio of over 200 brands. The company sells 1.9 billion servings daily across 200 countries and has a solid 15% return on invested capital. KO has a competitive moat due to its leverage over distribution and ability to buy out competing brands. The company is a Dividend King with 62 consecutive annual dividend increases and a dividend payout ratio of 68% of 2024 earnings. KO's stock trades at 22 times 2024 earnings, below its five-year average price-to-earnings ratio of 26. The company's slow-and-steady growth and stable dividend make it a solid long-term investment opportunity.
